scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L is a star with 0.3 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 3913.87 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L system


OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L b

OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L b was discovered by the KMTNet observatory, in 2016-06, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 1.60 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L b is 1081.200 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L b is 13.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the KMTNet.
name: OGLE-2015-BLG-0954L - System With 1 Exoplanet
